strings.onboardLongDescription: With a port only steps away from diverse neighborhoods and lively beaches, you can feel the Catalan beat through the heart of this sensational Spanish city.

agendaPreview.noBookingText: You don’t currently have any bookings for this day. Go ahead and fill your boots!

activities.displayName: Discover Barcelona’s Beauty & Beer Walking Tour
activities.shortDescription: Tour Barcelona’s streets and sip Spanish beer
activities.longDescription: Walk (and drink) your way through history. Starting from the World Trade Center, you’ll set off on Barcelona’s bustling streets with a stop at the iconic Botero Cat sculpture before ascending toward Mercat de Sant Antoni. Next stop: Fábrica Moritz for a cold beer and to learn about Barcelona’s brewing history. Then you’ll head to Plaza Catalunya to enjoy panoramic views and another refreshing drink at Sky Bar. End the day with a stroll down La Rambla to take in its many historic landmarks.
highlightDetails: Walk down La Rambla and see multiple historic landmarks
Drinks and panoramic views at Sky Bar
Stop at the iconic Plaza Catalunya
Beer and brewing history lesson at Fábrica Moritz
Visit the historic Mercat de Sant Antoni
Photo op at the Botero Cat sculpture
Stroll through the eclectic Raval district
activities.introduction: Walk the charming streets of Barcelona and learn the city’s history with multiple stops along the way to enjoy a refreshing drink and panoramic views.
instructionDetails: This Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible
Sailors should expect long periods of walking

activities.shortDescription: Have a glass of Cava in a Catalonian cellar
activities.longDescription: Travel an hour from Barcelona to Penedes, a region famous for its cellars and wineries, to taste a cellar's selection of Cava. This refreshing, sparkling wine is the Spanish version of champagne, proudly produced in Catalonia due to its mild Mediterranean climate. Learn the techniques used to make Cava wine as well as its cultural significance before crafting your own glass.
highlightDetails: Discover Cava's cultural significance while tasting an artisanal cellar's selection
Learn from the cellar’s owners how to make your own glass of Cava
Visit the Penedes region, famous for its many cellars and wineries
activities.introduction: Love a glass of bubbly? Visit the Penedes region to taste an artisanal cellar's selection of Cava and learn how to craft your own.
instructionDetails: Approximately 1 hour drive back to the pier
This Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible

activities.displayName: Poble Espanyol Sangría Workshop & Pastry Tasting
activities.shortDescription: Make fresh sangría and sample Catalonian pastries
activities.longDescription: Savor Barcelona with a trip to the charming village of Poble Espanyol. First stop at historic Montjuic hill, a former military station that is now a hub of art and culture. Next, you’ll head to Poble Espanyol for a workshop on making Sangría de Cava, a variation of Spanish sangría using sparkling cava wine infused with fresh fruit flavors. Then, you’ll get a taste of Catalonia by sampling a savory pastry known as coques de recapte before enjoying some leisure time and heading back to the ship.
highlightDetails: Leisure time to explore Poble Espanyol
Taste Catalonian savory pastries coques de recapte
Exclusive workshop on making sangría de cava
Visit the charming village of Poble Espanyol
activities.introduction: Take a trip to Poble Espanyol where you’ll learn how to make authentic Sangría de Cava and sample coques de recapte, a savory Catalonian pastry.
instructionDetails: Approximately 1 hour of free time in Poble Espanyol
This Shore Thing is not wheelchair accessible

activities.displayName: Post Voyage: Sitges by the Sea
activities.shortDescription: Relax and recharge on the gorgeous Catalan coast
activities.longDescription: Just south of Barcelona lies Sitges, a picturesque town on the Catalan coast known for its film festivals and sandy beaches. Here you'll have free time to stroll down Sitges' historic Old Town streets, swim in the Mediterranean, walk along the shore, or just relax in the breeze.
highlightDetails: Visit Sitges, a seaside town with captivating beauty and sandy beaches
Spend the day relaxing, swimming, or taking a long walk along the beach
Explore the historic Old Town at your leisure
activities.introduction: Visit Sitges, a charming seaside town about 40km from Barcelona, to explore the historic streets of Old Town and its beach.
instructionDetails: Post-Voyage Shore Thing: Pick up at Pier - drop off at Airport
Recommended for Sailors with International flights no earlier than 6pm
This Shore Thing operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria

activities.displayName: Post Voyage Transfer: Terminal to BCN Airport
activities.shortDescription: Hop from the terminal to the airport
activities.longDescription: Saying adiós to Valiant Lady is hard enough. Have one less thing to worry about with a pre-arranged transfer to take you from the terminal to BCN and use those last minutes in Barcelona to soak up the vibes.
highlightDetails: Kick back and enjoy your time, knowing that you have pre-arranged transportation to the airport for extra peace of mind
activities.introduction: Pre-book a transfer from the terminal to the airport, and make your way to BCN with peace of mind.
instructionDetails: Please make sure that the transfer's scheduled departure allows sufficient time for international and domestic flights
Traffic delays are possible en route to BCN Airport — please plan accordingly

tourDifferentiators.name: Sustainable Tours
tourDifferentiators.description: This tour operator has received third-party certification based on the Global Sustainable Tourism Council criteria.
